item.title: No 10 says 'nothing off the table' over new US tariffs as UK could be among worst hit
item.content:encoded: Downing Street says discussions are ongoing following US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 15% global tariffs.

item.title: No 10 says ‘nothing off the table’ over new US tariffs as UK could be among worst hit

item.title: Teen guilty of belonging to banned neo-Nazi group
item.content:encoded: The boy, 16, is also convicted of the possession of terror documents and sharing terror publications.

item.title: Benfica's Prestianni gets provisional one-match ban after alleged racial abuse
item.content:encoded: Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni receives a provisional one-match Uefa suspension after Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr reported alleged racist abuse during last week's Champions League meeting.

item.title: Benfica's Prestianni gets provisional one-match ban after Vinicius incident
item.content:encoded: Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni receives a provisional one-match Uefa suspension after Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr reported alleged racist abuse during last week's Champions League meeting.

item.title: Why Leeds would be flying high without league-worst late-goal record
item.content:encoded: After conceding another late goal on Saturday, we look at the stats that show Leeds would be seventh in the Premier League if games ended after 85 minutes.

item.title: O'Sullivan signs up for World Seniors Championship
item.content:encoded: Ronnie O'Sullivan, 50, is set to make his debut in the World Seniors Snooker Championship at Sheffield's Crucible Theatre in May.

item.title: Briton among 19 killed in Nepal bus crash
item.content:encoded: Nepalese police say the British national was a 24-year-old man.

item.title: Rob Jetten becomes Netherlands' youngest ever PM
item.content:encoded: The 38-year-old is sworn in as premier after clinching a narrow victory in October's election.

item.title: 'Confront failure and fix it': Families speak ahead of Nottingham attacks inquiry
item.content:encoded: Hearings are under way at a public inquiry into attacks in Nottingham that killed three people.

item.title: Why has Alan Carr bought a castle and where is it?
item.content:encoded: The comedian has purchased a castle in the Scottish Borders which comes with 17 bedrooms and its own working railway.

item.title: Armed man killed after entering secure perimeter of Trump's residence, Secret Service says
item.content:encoded: The suspect was carrying a shotgun and fuel can when he was killed, officers say, while Trump was in Washington DC at the time.

item.title: Reform promises agency to ensure illegal migrant removals
item.content:encoded: The party's new home affairs spokesman Zia Yusuf says it would be a "burning" priority for a Reform UK government.

item.title: Australia backs removing Andrew from royal line of succession
item.content:encoded: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor remains eighth in line to the throne despite being stripped of his titles.

item.title: When is the Spring Statement and what might be in it?
item.content:encoded: Chancellor Rachel Reeves will give an update on her plans for the UK economy when she gives a statement alongside an economic forecast on 3 March.

item.title: Three countries, 25,000 miles - England's daunting summer itinerary
item.content:encoded: England will take to the skies for their summer fixtures against South Africa, Fiji and Argentina, posing difficult decisions for the team.

item.title: The key changes being made to special educational needs - at a glance
item.content:encoded: The government has set out broad changes it will make to the SEND system in England in the coming years.

item.content:encoded: Actors Michael B Jordan and Delroy Lindo were on stage at the time during the award ceremony in London.

item.title: Fifa wants injured players to stay off for one minute
item.content:encoded: Players who receive treatment for an injury could be forced to stay off the field for one minute under proposals from Fifa.

item.title: Netflix boss defends bid for Warner Bros as Paramount deadline looms
item.content:encoded: Ted Sarandos says his company's offer is better for industry growth as it is "buying assets we don't currently have".

item.title: 'Closest I've felt' - Hodgkinson on breaking longest-standing world record
item.content:encoded: Olympic champion Keely Hodgkinson says she feels "closer than ever" to breaking the women's 800m outdoor record - the longest-standing world record in athletics.

item.title: 'Closest I've felt' - Hodgkinson on breaking longest-standing world record

item.title: Cartel henchmen unleash violence after top drug lord killed in Mexico
item.content:encoded: The death of the most-wanted Jalisco cartel chief sparks retaliatory violence in at least a dozen states in Mexico.

item.content:encoded: Ofcom's £1.35m fine on 8579 LLC is the largest it has levied under the Online Safety Act so far.
